title: unable to connect to server, server timeout
content:
A couple weeks ago I started to have Thunderbird problems with a server timeout or unable to connect. I could neither read or write messages. I've set up Thunderbird using the ports specified by my ISP (lmi.net) without fixing the problem. My provider says that I may be overloading the server for some reason, and the mail server is blocking my ISP address under the assumption that the overloading is a spam attack.

I've discovered that there is another generic mail client on my PC that was apparently installed when I upgraded to Windows 10. I remember being asked for my email address when I installed Windows 10, but never thought they were asking for client email installation.

Have you run across any problems like this?
creator: albanyguy

title: Thunderbird 115.2
content: My macine updated to 115.2, and now I cannot print emails. When 'print' is pushed as a choice, the pane shows PDF and save to file as my only choice. What is the fix, please
creator: wheelandch

title: can't send emails
content: i use mozilla thunderbird i can't send emails so i need someone to give me a call to solve this problem it comes up with an error saying Login to server mail.iinet.net.au failed have tried every thing with my service provider but can't solve problem
creator: jmarinus55

title: Thunderbird Privacy Notice tab keeps appearing.
content:
Why does the Thunderbird Privacy Notice tab keep appearing?

Is there a way to turn it off?
creator: leehsoon

title: Thunderbird marking wrongs items as spam
content: Since the last time I updated Thunderbird a few weeks ago, emails that I have always gotten are suddenly appearing in my spam folder instead of my inbox. I missed a couple of important emails because of this. Meanwhile, emails that are clearly spam are going to my inbox. How can this be corrected?
creator: b52balmer

title: TB Reinstalled -> Inbox, Sent Mail and all Subfolders Lost (AOL is mail provider)
content: TB reinstalled to remove glitches occurring for months, if not years. Upon reinstall, discovered emails from inbox, sent mail, subfolders were lost. In simple terms, can all of the years and years of emails from the AOL account (inbox, sent mail, subfolders) be retrieved and visible on TB again? Can go back to my computer support network for assistance but would like to give it a try myself. Novice. Thank you in advance for kind words and step by step instructions for dummies. What information is needed from me?
creator: dmax2
